meanings.definition: A person or thing that presses.
meanings.sent1: The presser pushed down on the lever to flatten the dough.
meanings.sent2: I need a presser to help me with the laundry.
meanings.sent3: The little presser toy kept squishing everything in sight.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was a powerful presser on her to succeed.
meanings.sent5: The heavy presser left a clear imprint on the paper.

meanings.sent1: The old presser in the laundry room still works perfectly.
meanings.sent2: She used the presser to iron her favorite shirt.
meanings.sent3: The presser seemed to have a mind of its own, pressing random creases.
meanings.sent4: The presser hummed softly as it smoothed out the wrinkles.
meanings.sent5: The steam presser made quick work of the pile of clothes.

meanings.sent1: As a negotiator, he was a skilled presser in getting deals done.
meanings.sent2: The presser at the car dealership convinced me to buy the car.
meanings.sent3: The little girl turned into a presser when she wanted more candy.
meanings.sent4: His words were a gentle presser on her to reconsider her decision.
meanings.sent5: The presser in the meeting room made everyone feel the tension.
